item.title: Distribution of porcupine meat
item.summary: Various parts of the porcupine are given to specific people in the group, for instance the wife of the man who killed the porcupine eats its tail. The hunter and the children eat its shoulder meat.
item.comments: 1) See The little porcupine, 2) This story is found in Book VIII-16
item.author: |hanâ‰ kass'o (Klein Jantje) (VIII)

keyword.subkw: the sharing or distribution of porcupine meat
parts of the porcupine that are eaten
eaten by different members of the group
eaten by the hunter and his family
